rules.natural: Provided that the researcher used a laptop device, then the researcher attended a workshop event.
Whenever the researcher networked with an industry expert happens, the researcher winning the best paper award follows.

rules.prover9_expression: (gave_talk(researcher, keynote) -> (-(submitted_paper(researcher, neural_networks) -> has_skill(researcher, ai_programming)) -> attended_event(researcher, workshop)))
rules.natural: Under the condition that the researcher gave a keynote talk, then if it is not the case that (if the researcher submitted a paper on neural networks, then the researcher has the skill of AI programming), the researcher attended a workshop event.
If the researcher chaired the ML track session, then either the researcher networked with an industry expert or the researcher gave a keynote talk.
Either the researcher chaired the ML track session or the researcher demoed a prototype.
Provided that the researcher demoed a prototype, then either the researcher networked with an industry expert or the researcher gave a keynote talk.

Under the condition that it is not the case that (if the researcher submitted a paper on neural networks, then the researcher has the skill of AI programming), then the researcher used a laptop device.
If the tech conference was not funded, then the researcher submitted a paper on neural networks.
Provided that the tech conference was not funded, then it is not the case that the researcher has the skill of AI programming.

facts.natural: The researcher did not attend a workshop event.
It is not the case that the researcher won the best paper award.
